مصاء الخير/ صباح الخير على حسب موقعك على الكرة الأرضية،
كنت حابب افتح نقاش صغير، فى الفترة الأخيرة حسيت اننى Over burned الproductivity و الactivity كانوا اصعب يوم بعد يوم، و اللى فهمته ان ده من ضغط الشغل و اننى حتى بكون فى جو الشغل حتى لو مش فى الشغل، فحاولت اخد اجازة لمدة اسبوعين -على اساس ان كده هايكون كفاية لإستعادة النشاط- لكن واجهتنى مشكلة تانية 
ازاى اخد الأجازة اصلآ، اعمل إيه فى الأجازة اروح فين وآجى منين ؟ افك الضغط اللى على مخى ازاى
المهم ان الموضوع انتهى ب٣ خروجة متوسطة الطول
٢ لعبة من العصر الجليدى للألعاب و اللى وهقت منهم فى الآخر
خلصت الجزئين الأول و الثانى من البوكيمون و اكتشفت انهم ١٤ جزء :O
عاوز اعرف كل واحد هنا بيحافظ ازاى على الwork-life balance و لما بيحس انه مضغوط بزيادة بيعمل إيه ؟

Mohamed Elsherif: إيه رأيك؟

I have extremely rigid rules about my work-life balance. This is long.

Things I do to prevent burn outs:
------------------------------
1. Always have emotional stability, if I'm experiencing an emotional issue I'll do bad at work. So I make sure my love relationships are stable and I keep around me friends that aren't the attached type. 

I can go on months without contact, busy building a startup and meet up again with them, picking up from where we left like it was yesterday.

2. I never answer work calls or emails on my days off. This leaves me time to give to my loved ones, family and friends. Which contributes to my emotional stability

3. I invest time, money and effort in automating my work chores. Since I don't answer phone calls or emails on my days off, for all I know, our servers can burn and I wouldn't know about it. 

So I invest a lot of myself building/buying tools to take over my place when I'm not paying attention.

I also don't expect any employees/partners to pay attention on their time off. So this is critical and it helps me sleep better at night.

4. I make sure I write code everyday, doesn't matter if I'm completely burnt out or not. 30 minutes to an hour of coding everyday is a must.

This turned the process into a mental routine, so now I can write code even when I'm burnt out, drained and have a deadline.

5. I make sure the people in my life take the biggest portion of my day either in-kind or in-time. 
Meaning, I don't need to spend 6 hours with a girlfriend everyday but I can do her something worth the effort of 6 hours and she'll appreciate it. 

I also pay attention to people, birthdays, nice events in their lives and congratulate them and celebrate with them.

This gives me a strong emotional boost, takes my mind off work for sometime and replenishes my energy.

6. After 7PM, no work. No work. No work. 
I don't care if a problem is persisting, problems wont go away. The problem will be there in the next morning but my capacity to solve it will decrease when I burn out.

7. I taught myself to stop everything just before I burn out. Sometimes that's not an option but disconnecting helps me regain some energy so the next day/week I'll be back to normal.

In case none of my counter measures work and I end up burnt out.

I disconnect completely, no computers, no email, no internet, no twitter, no facebook, no phone calls. I'll spend 2-3 days going out, eating out, hanging out with buddies, partying or what ever.

Lastly, always remember
 - If you're pressured by 2x, your burn rate increases to 8x
 - If your burn rate is at 8x you'll burn out in less time
 - If you burn out faster, your output drops
 - If your output drops your pressure goes up to 4x
 - if your pressure is at 4x, your burn rate increases
 - But wait... You already burnt out. So you stay burnt out longer
...etc.

You do yourself a service by disconnecting early and often.
